title: Block image on Specific site
content:
How to block images on specific websites?

about:config -> permissions.default.image = 2 This will will block on all websites. but I want to block on specific website.
creator: farhan.rashid

title: Intranet server unreachable
content:
Hi! I have a company network with about 30 PCs, no domain, but a working internal DNS. There is a server within the network running a webapplication (ASPX). The firewall regulations are very strict, so there are only two hands full of websites reachable from the network. Until now (version 82.x) it was enough to put the adress http://server in the address line of Firefox to open the application. After updating to version 83.0 the server is not reachable anymore, firefox automatically tries to open http://www.server.com "ping server" works, use of \\server in windows explorer and opening an RDP-Connection to "server" works also!

Why is that so and are there any solutions?

Thanks in advance!

Best regards

Peter
creator: peter.fasol

title: SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER error
content:
Hi For some reasons im unable to access these websites zoopla.co.uk, rightmove.couk, mouseprice.com, primelocation.com, ebay.co.uk on my firefox 78.4.0esr and get the error SEC_ERROR_UNKNOWN_ISSUER with no option to advance. I can access these sites on Internet explorer & chrome but weird why Firefox is blocking it. Is there a workaround this please


Ps: i have no 3rd party anti virus and tried using this article https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/error-codes-secure-websites but no joy

Thanks
creator: subomidavid

title: Problems with some websites
content: Hi everybody! Recently I've been signing in an amazon prime account which gives me access to many service. One of them is Prime Video. I've never been able to use Prime with Firefox. It let's me navigate inside the website but when it's time to stream the movie/series/stuff that I choose, it tells me that I can't because I need to get the latest version of Firefox. Well... It's nothing special in this case, since it's just entertainment. But very recently (less than a week) I have the same problem with whatsapp web. And this is quite annoying since I use it for work and to have another browser open makes me slow down on my job. Can you tell me if there's a solution to this? My version of Mozilla Firefox is 83.0 (64 bit) and it says it's the latest. No need to update. Sorry, the pictures are in italian (I'm from Italy). Let me know if you need any help with translation. Thank you in advance!
creator: ferrante.alessandro

title: Bare pages only display, without images, links or formatting
content: I mainly use Firefox. I worked offline on a couple of mails on yahoo webmail, intending to send them in the morning. On waking up, I went online to send wanted to send them, but they could not. Needless to say, the texts of those mails have been lost and were not saved as drafts. All my firefox pages, old and new, now open as bare pages, without links, formatting, pics or functionalities. I am not even able to upload here an image of my screen on a typical page. My email is denisbridoux@yahoo.com.
creator: denisbridoux

title: Is it possible to extract Add-on settings from a profile backup?
content:
I tried to change some things in about:config which resulted in websites not working properly and reverting the changes wouldn't fix it, so I had to do a refresh of Firefox. The sites work like they used to now.

I'm still confused about Firefox Sync's functionality because when I set it up to sync my tabs it never wants to do it, but immediately after the refresh it downloaded all of my Add-ons right away, which was nice to see. However, my settings/options from those Add-ons are missing, like my uBlock filter lists or various Tampermonkey user scripts.

Is there any way I could recover the Add-on settings from the profile backup which the refresh created on my Desktop? There's a folder called browser-extension-data with some other folders inside, but they're all empty. I tried looking for it myself but couldn't find solutions. I also have a complete profile backup I manually made just before I the Refresh as a safety measure if needed. Thank you very much..!
creator: syuro

title: Backing up and restoring lost tabs
content:
I often experience situations on Firefox where I lose all of my important tabs which I never end up getting back, despite having 'restore previous session' turned on. For instance, it happens when a software forcefully opens a "Thank you for installing" site while Firefox wasn't running, or when I accidentally open a link in a new window while being on private mode, when I meant to open it in a new private window instead..

On a different browser I used before switching to Firefox, I used to resolve this by going to it's profile location and looking at two files named "Current Session" and "Last Session". I could just rename the "Last Session" file to "Current Session", and all of my tabs would return. I was hoping Firefox would have something similar, but it seems either impossible or maybe just a bit more complicated, since I cannot find anything regarding this on the web.

Each time this happens to me, I go to my Firefox profile folder but cannot really find anything regarding sessions I could replace and restore. Only thing I managed to back up from the various important tabs I lost were six files in a fashion like this:

recovery.jsonlz4, upgrade.jsonlz4-[a lot of numbers]

Can I use these files to recover my lost tabs somehow, similar to how I used to do it in the different browser? Hopefully I'm understandable, it's a bit complicated to explain for me.
creator: syuro

title: A Web Page Invader has taken control of All my Tabs in Firefox
content:
I have a web page hanger on in my Firefox browser, every time I open a new Tab that web page is there. So now, I can't even use my Tabs in Firefox. Does anybody know a cure for this ???

Below is what shows up when I right-click that page, and choose Source Code

<meta charset="utf-8"> <meta http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy" content="default-src 'none'; object-src 'none'; script-src resource: chrome:; connect-src https:; img-src https: data: blob:; style-src 'unsafe-inline';"> <title data-l10n-id="newtab-page-title"></title> <link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="chrome://branding/content/icon32.png"> <link rel="localization" href="branding/brand.ftl"> <link rel="localization" href="browser/branding/brandings.ftl"> <link rel="localization" href="browser/newtab/newtab.ftl"> <link rel="stylesheet" href="chrome://browser/content/contentSearchUI.css"> <link rel="stylesheet" href="chrome://activity-stream/content/css/activity-stream.css">
creator: danslink
